disease: Malignant melanoma of left ear and external auricular canal

symptoms.name: Skin changes (mole changes in size, color, texture, or shape)

physical_findings: 3x3cm spherical swelling in the right post auricular region
Swelling variable in consistency and very tender
Skin over swelling stretched, shiny, and smooth except for a small 0.5x0.5cm irregular ulcer with indurated margins
Mass in EAC firm in consistency, highly vascular, and friable
Bluish-black mass arising in the EAC (in one case)

imaging_findings.CT scan of right temporal bone: Large ill-defined homogenous, moderately enhancing infiltrative soft tissue lesion occupying the entire EAC causing widening and erosion of anterior, posterior, and inferior walls of the bony part of the EAC. Scutum, long process, and lenticular process of incus appeared irregular and eroded.
imaging_findings.Bone scan: Increased tracer concentration in the right temporal bone

required: Histopathological examination showing sheets and nests of atypical melanocytes with large pleomorphic nuclei, prominent nucleoli, and melanin pigment (may be absent)
Immunohistochemistry positive for HMB45 and S100
supportive: Clinical presentation with ear pain, bleeding, swelling, and mass
Imaging findings showing mass in EAC with bone erosion

differential_diagnoses: Acute mastoiditis with subperiosteal abscess with aural polyp
